website_summaries.verdict: An affordable, but quality storage bag that gives you a clear view of your yarn.
pros: Clear material lets you see everything you have stored without opening the bag
Holds up to 6 skeins of yarn
Yarn slides easily through 6 top holes
Large storage compartment is perfect for holding unfinished projects
cons: Bag doesn't hold its upright shape unless full of yarn

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I like the bag overall, but am really disappointed in the quality of construction though. I have used it to carry my projects around the house as I work, and occasionally out of the house. Maybe my 4th or 5th time carrying this out of the house, one side of the strap came off. No rips in the plastic or fabric - the loop connecting the strap to the bag just popped off. Today, maybe a week later, the second one popped off. I had skeins and a small section of what I was working on in the bag. If the handles would have stayed attached it would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Erin S.

customer_reviews.title: One star item not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Dont waste your money..... The size is perfect for carrying yarns and accessories the idea is great with yarn separated, For. Doing needlework ...however the material is cheap and I purchased two , for myself and a gift,the zippers are poor quality and ALL of them broke on each case within a week!. Also the handle hangs oddly on your shoulder and the bag even when filled with items doesnt stand up correctly when crocheting/knitting.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Sparkman

customer_reviews.title: Design
customer_reviews.text: Okay, so I knew this wasn’t going to be the greatest thing in the World, however, I just needed something to keep my yarn separated while I’m working on projects. It says separate compartments and the image appears to have 6, but mine only has 3. It will fit six but there will be 2 in each compartment. This is the biggest piece of crap I’ve ever bought. I’m Not well enough to take it to the store to return it. So I guess I’m stuck with it. Don’t wast your money!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Shari

customer_reviews.title: not well made
customer_reviews.text: The plastic in the construction of this doesn't want to lie flat. The entire unit keeps collapsing. I cut cardboard to fit all 4 sides, but on one long wall, the plastic interferes with the "box" having square corners, so I couldn't press the cardboard into that side. The whole thing needs to go back to the drawing board. I am still fiddling with the thing, but I have a feeling I'll give up at some point and throw it away. The yarn/craft companies make yarn totes lots better than this one---don't waste your money on this.
customer_reviews.author: pattyb

customer_reviews.title: Happily Surprised
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Size of bag: inside pocket can hold 2 Caron One Pound comfortably. Plastic pockets anything smaller than Caron one Pound would fit just find. I was really surprised how big this bag is. Pockets: There are about 4 nice various size pockets that you can put books, supplies, etc. Cons: opening up bag had a stinky smell but airing out the smell seemed to go away. For price and size I think this is a great bag.
customer_reviews.author: Addicted to Books

customer_reviews.title: Multiple skeins/balls of yarn get tangled together
customer_reviews.text: Enough storage pockets for patterns, notions, etcWhen trying to use this product for more than one project recently due to the 6 yarn holes; the 4 smaller balls of yarn (3-4 oz each) went under the fabric wall of zippered pockets and began to get tangled together. What a mess! It took several hours to untangle everything because the yarn was being drawn up through the holes in the top.
customer_reviews.author: kathleen Hicswa

customer_reviews.title: Ideal to take it with you whatever you go.
customer_reviews.text: This crocheting bag is perfect to keep everything you need in one place and organized and neat. Has plenty of room. All the zippers are in good condition. It's ideal to take it whatever you go and that works for me. Seems bigger than shown in the picture. To keep its shape I just filled it and that's the original idea. The middle compartment isn't sewing to the bottom so little things can go under from one compartment to the next one. But I don't think I'm going to put nothing little there, having plenty of pockets for that. It came on time as predicted. I will buy another for my friend birthday. Since she likes mine.
customer_reviews.author: Silvia V.

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: I was very wary about this item based on other reviews, but so far it's going strong. You can fit quite a bit of yarn in it, and the pouch to put your work in is very handy. The straps aren't adjustable, which is my main issue with it. If I don't stuff it full of stuff, it collapses in on itself which makes it a little difficult to work with as well, so I just put a lot of yarn in it. Overall a very handy carrying case, we'll have to wait and see how long it lasts though.
customer_reviews.author: Felicia Ninness

customer_reviews.title: It's All in the Bag
customer_reviews.text: It's okay to keep yarn in, but the compartments on the side keeps mixing in with the big compartment with all the other yarn so I have to keep fishing out my project. It doesn't unzip all the way around so it can be difficult to get access to the bag as the opening is rather small. I do like how portable it is. There are lots of little compartments to store things.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy

customer_reviews.title: Nice yarn organizer
customer_reviews.text: I really like this tote. It has lots of storage space and keeps the yarn in place quite well. I didn't have any issues with zippers or the vinyl, it was in perfect condition. It has little velcro strips to keep the yarn from falling back in, it's very helpful. You send it through the grommets and you will have to clip the yarn, or finish the skein to remove it, but that doesn't pose much of an issue for me.
customer_reviews.author: LessThanJess

customer_reviews.title: Cost is low But Quality is Great.
customer_reviews.text: I Liked Everything about it. Especially the Price, I saw it elsewhere for 12.99 and up. Pros.... You can fit 2 regular skeins of yarn in each compartment. If you're using two different colors at the same time you can feed both colors through the same hole for. I use round knitting looms that fit well in the big portion of the case. Cons... None . Side note... You can always put a thin piece of cardboard in between the skeins.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis

customer_reviews.title: MILES KIMBALL KNITTING TOTE BAG
customer_reviews.text: I didn't like the bag. It is cheap because it's made cheap. If it was made sturdier, I'll love it. The compartments for the yarn are a good idea with holes in the top to keep your yarn clean and untangled. Each compartment has a zipper. They're the kind of zippers that go up or down with no end pieces like pants but this also allows them to pop open all the time. On the other side they had a large compartment for books or your project. It had a side compartment. I sent it back because it was so flimsy and the zippers. I would not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Romero

customer_reviews.title: You get what you paid for...
customer_reviews.text: Garbage. Pros: Lots of space for yarn, knitting, and crochet items. Cons: Everything else, the zippers all broke off, the plastic is cheap, the material of the bag wears and tears over time. I ended up throwing it away after a few months. Do yourself a favor and invest in a nicer storage bag.
customer_reviews.author: 7Avocado40

customer_reviews.title: Nice little yarn bag
customer_reviews.text: Nice little yarn bag, really helpful in preventing yarn from turning into a huge ball of tangles. Great for storing your project while you are working on it and big enough to fit my reference book and patterns all in one place. I really have found it useful and now I don't have hooks and yarn just laying all over the place. So far it has held up pretty well but i'm not sure how great the quality of the materials are. My friend has one that she hauls all over the place and it still is intact so I am hopeful mine will last as well.
customer_reviews.author: Clair mullins

customer_reviews.title: Knitting tote bag okay
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that it has multiple pockets and can store your books and needles and all the supplies that you need neatly in it. But my strap broke and had to sew it back up to be able to carry again. Also one of the little eyelets fell out so not very structurely sound in my opinion but other than that it does what it is suppose to do. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bag is poor quality similar to overseas eBay bargains at retail price
customer_reviews.text: you can store yarn in this thing and other knitting odds and ends. Was disappointed by the quality of this for the price is super cheap. The thin plastic like material is sewn flimsy to black parts of bag and will easily rip apart of you over stuff this. can fit 4 balls up front and another 8 in back. If u aren't going into it alot or traveling it might last. If looking for a traveling bag or something of decent quality don't buy this.
customer_reviews.author: beth

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginning knitters who need an organizational system
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag as a beginning knitter who didn't want to spend a $30 or $40 in case I only knit sporadically. This little bag is awesome. I was able to put several different yarn skeins into the top zipper compartments. The side compartment holds some of my small knitting books perfectly, and my tools fit into various other side compartments. Overall, this is a great little bag at a great price. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: JR112

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth the Money/Poorly Made
customer_reviews.text: This fell apart after carrying it out of the house only 3 times. If it were sturdy, it would get 5 stars. The design is amazing, but it's a cheap piece of junk. If you're going to leave it sit you're fine, but if you want a real tote don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Cherokee Chick

customer_reviews.title: Organization, travels well.
customer_reviews.text: This case has so many nooks and crannies its fantastic for keeping yarns and ribbon organized. It made a great gift. It's super helpful if you're apart of a knitters club and you need to bring products around town. Everything in one place. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Hanna JBauer

customer_reviews.title: This knitting tote is great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of the knitting totes, one for me and the other as a present for my sister-in-law. The tote is light weight, has more room to store additional materials than I though, and is great for taking my crochet projects with me wherever I go. Although the material may not be as durable as much more expensive totes, it is durable enough to perform well. I am quite happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle B.

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love it. It fits 6 large skeins of yarn ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow, just received it today. Absolutely love it. It fits 6 large skeins of yarn in the front It has holes to stick the yarn through and it has a Velcro tab for each color of yarn to keep it in place. The back compartment is big. I have put my finished granny squares in it and the instruction manual also. It also has 2 side pockets - 1 with a zipper and one closed with Velcro. Nice strong strap. Love, Love it. I'm ordering another one today and probably more in the future when I get more pocket change. One for most of my projects. It is just what I wanted. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri Winchester

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag! It is roomy and holds so much stuff. My only issue (and I've seen someone else complain as well) is that there is nothing to place in the bottom to keep the sides from collapsing unless it is absolutely full. I only fill it with supplies for the current project I am on, so this was a problem. To remedy, however, I just measured and cut a thick piece of cardboard and laid it into the bottom. Otherwise, it's a GREAT organizer!
customer_reviews.author: Charli Gamache

customer_reviews.title: Like the size
customer_reviews.text: I like the size and consider it a decent bag to keep yarns separate and easy to use without tangling. However, the first time I actually toted it with me one strap broke. I had to burn the edges and pin it back together. I do not like the Velcro on yarn and choose not to use that option to hold yarn ends. It is a good price compared to the more upscale options.
customer_reviews.author: Karen S.

customer_reviews.title: You won't find a better knitting bag at this price!
customer_reviews.text: This bag is amazing. I love it. It holds the yarn I'm using for current projects and has enough storage for my needles, instructions, and any other trinkets I might need. I wish I would have bought one of these years ago. I love that there are velcro straps at the time to hold the yarn in place. It makes the yarn easy to access and keeps everything neat and orderly. I cannot say enough good things about this bag. Because it is transparent, I can easily glance at it to see if I need to switch out the yarn for different projects. I just love it.
customer_reviews.author: Pensive Aspie

customer_reviews.title: Organized!
customer_reviews.text: I like the organization of this bag. I do wish there was a way of taking a project ( in process) out of the bag [which a reviewer said can be done, however indeed cannot.] The bag is a little pricey, given the lightness of the material. I do hope that this proves to be durable - if it does, than the price will prove to be worth it. I bought several bags so that I can keep several current projects organized. I also just purchased additional bags to give to my daughter. Love that there are various zippered compartments.
customer_reviews.author: MomOf3

customer_reviews.title: Bad beg
customer_reviews.text: The bottom side lining was untouched when I received it. Easy fix so I did. I put some yarn in and a yarn flippers some place markers and 4different sizes needles and 3 crochet hooks, I lifted the bag and the plastic hook on the side broke. The inside of the bag was empty so I figured it was very faulty. I replaced all the plastic parts and Velcro with new melt hooks and better Velcro. It's a fantastic bag. By the way I just changed out the side Velcro not the top. Good luck.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The bags are a great concept and yes
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these tote bags as Christmas gifts a few weeks ago. The strap on one of them unraveled immediately after it was removed from the plastic wrapping and filled with yarn in the different compartments. I contacted the vendor and they are sending me a replacement bag. The bags are a great concept and yes, the material may be less than favorable. But, the vendor's customer service is great!
customer_reviews.author: Marcos A. Munoz

customer_reviews.title: Lots of storage space!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to hold yarn for a graphgan that requires multiple skeins. Lots of storage space. Love the extra pockets. Was a little difficult to reshape on delivery, but a night stuffed with paper did the trick. I do wish the back zipper went all the way around or was placed on top as access to the back section is a little awkward. Great bag, great value overall.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Very cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Just received my bag & it is very cheaply made ! I hope it surprised me & I hope it holds up for awhile or it will be returned ! One of the side clear pouches that doesn't zip has a piece of Velcro for a closure, but the strap that attaches to it is sewn backwards so I have to twist the strap to keep it attached... I was able to fit 3 caron one pound yarn skeins but they are not full so I'm not sure if it will even hold 3 full skeins, but I hope so! If it was made with thicker materials & full separated inside it would be awesome.x
customer_reviews.author: TonyWontMiss

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: Best buy ever! I'm absolutely in love with my bag. This is exactly what I needed. I really can't find a complaint. Fyi, although not displayed it comes with a place to hold your work. Perfect when knitting and crocheting blankets A weeks later the zipper broke, but it's still a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Latasha Potts

customer_reviews.title: JUNK! Don't Waste Your Money!
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply Made & Not worth the Money I paid for it! My Yarn is all over the Bag! The Entire Bag is Flimsy & my Skeins slip under the bottom into the other compartment. The Grommets are ripping through the cheap plastic. Worst Piece of Merchandise ever made! Make it out of Quality Materials then it would be worth $20 bucks. Otherwise it's just JUNK! I don't want a refund glad I get to let others know that this product is a Waste of their Money! I have no clue what other Customers Received, but I had high hopes for this product & ended up with nothing but disappointment!
customer_reviews.author: QQ

customer_reviews.title: Lots of room!
customer_reviews.text: There is so much room. I’m able to store my yarn, stitch markers, buttons, and hooks. When you first open it, the plastic smells strong but it doesn’t last long and did not cause my yarn to smell. I do wish the dividers inside were my rigid.
customer_reviews.author: urkey82

customer_reviews.title: Love this bag it’s awesome
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love love love this bag it’s huge and has so many awesome compartments for lots of knitting storage. It is everything you would want in a knitting carry bag and the quality is great as well, shipping was fast and on time as well. Very pleased will buy again for sure and definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Ray white

customer_reviews.title: was disappointed, this is a gift for my granddaughter
customer_reviews.text: was disappointed, this is a gift for my granddaughter. the zippers are nylon so break easily and the plastic is so wrinkled it's almost hard to see the 6 yarns I put into it. I realize the large pocket is for projects, but until she gets some in there the whole thing just looks wrinkled. it also came with no box, no name showing what it is and describing pockets ect. also there is just a fabric behind where the yarns go so no support to hold them very well.
customer_reviews.author: B. Clark

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT 💞
customer_reviews.text: this is great I live in the country and have a lot of dust putting my yarn in it help keep it dust free. (One of the reasons I bought it) they yarn feeds through nicely. On a down side I wish they would have made it with a firmer base. With only my yarn,a few pattern book, and my crochet supplies it doesn't want to sit up straight. Which I solved by putting a piece of cardboard in the base. So all work out good.😀 I would most definitely buy again
customer_reviews.author: sharky

customer_reviews.title: If you crochet, you need this bag.
customer_reviews.text: This is the neatest product. It's a huge plastic bag that holds your yarn, your project, and all the hooks and needles you could ever need. Wish I'd bought this earlier. And you can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: I love the idea of this bag
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea of this bag, however the the first time I used the bag the zipper broke. The end were not sewn securely, it pulled apart, and the zipper head came off and I can not use the zipper now. I will try to resew it myself and use velcro to close it. The bag itself is very spacious, and the compartments and holes for the different yarns is a great idea. I love it, but again, it needs to be sewn more securely. The seller did an excellent job, I received it almost right after I ordered it.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy K

customer_reviews.title: Best on the go yarn storage
customer_reviews.text: This is absolutely perfect for keeping my yarn in order. It stores three different spools at a time, with plenty of room in the back for more yarn that isn't being used. There is also a little pocket for tools. My yarn doesn't roll all over the ground now when I make blankets. I can also pick up and go easily when I'm on the move but want to take my work with me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: just okay...won't use very often.
customer_reviews.text: its definitely flimsy. I needed it to carry yarn on vacation and that is all I've used it for. it doesn't have any stabilizers in it so once the yarn skein gets smaller the whole things collapses. It kept my yarn clean and safe though. it could use cardboard or something stiff inside to make it better. i read the other reviews and decided to go for it just so i could take 6 skeins of yarn. this has so much potential...just needs some tweaks.
customer_reviews.author: LcharapichTop Contributor: Nail Polish

customer_reviews.title: Great for knitters
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews and am waiting for the results. GREAT case, functional, portable. but waiting to see how the actual product is against the reviews. I love it. I go to a place every Tuesday and take it with me, lets see how it works out.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Don't  use all of the pockets. The bag will break.
customer_reviews.text: This bag DOES NOT hold the yarn and your crochet things because if you put everything you need for your project the bag snaps. I finally had reason to use it and put the stuff for the project in and the strap popped. Of course I didn't use it until well after I bought it so I couldn't send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Shelton H.

customer_reviews.title: great for traveling
customer_reviews.text: i use it for traveling and to keep yarn from tangling
customer_reviews.author: lillie marie mcgee

customer_reviews.title: Very roomy!
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag. It holds about four skeins of yarn so you can hold the skeins that you aren't using yet. I love all the pockets that you can put all your hooks, the pattern you're using and whatever else you might need. When I opened the package I was a little worried. The bag was flat and folded but once you put your yarn in it stays up. The other side of the bag is open where you can put the project you are working on. Yes the divider does not go all the way to the top but it hasn't been a problem. I am very happy with this product!
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Great yarn bag for $11
customer_reviews.text: After all the bad reviews I was not expecting much but, it’s a great yarn bag. All the zippers work ,holds a large amount of yarn and other items. No weird smell. The strap may be a little less than high quality but, as long as your not toting rocks it should be fine. It is a bit flimsy but, mine is full of yarn so it stands up. It’s not a super heavy duty prime quality yarn bag but for $11 great deal.
customer_reviews.author: syrena

customer_reviews.title: Not the quality I would like.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a Christmas gift so I couldn’t return in the time I needed. Quality was poor. Price was right. I guess it will do it’s job until it doesn’t. The concept is perfect it’s just the materials used are cheap.
customer_reviews.author: * Burks *

customer_reviews.title: Easy to take with you
customer_reviews.text: Nice bag to hold all of my different colored yarns. It does collapse easily. I had a hard sided one years ago that was a little more user friendly, but this bag is much easier to take around with me. Being supple, it fits in more places I need to store it. The hard sided case was rather cumbersome. So, all that being said, I like this bag for its versatility and mobility.
customer_reviews.author: mrsjose2

customer_reviews.title: Great for the money!
customer_reviews.text: It needed a little more space or organization on the big open insie part. Also needee to be sectioned for ball yarn under the holes section. The yarn tangles when 2 balls are inserted.
customer_reviews.author: Candy  Ellebie

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: I thought this bag looked like the perfect thing for carrying and organizing my knitting projects, but it lasted less than 2 weeks. First, one of the tab carriers on top pulled off just when I tried to open the velcro. Next, one of the side pockets started tearing off. Then, the zipper broke on the opening for the main body. Don't waste your money on this cheaply made product.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's perfect for storing small or large amounts of yarn
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this bag and when it came I was so excited!! I carry the bag with me everywhere!!! It's perfect for storing small or large amounts of yarn. It's made to hold 6 skeins of yarn but I made 12 fit in there lol. It's got a zipper pocket on the back to hold your current projects, it has a zipper on top to hold your hooks or other small items. And it has a pocket on the side!! It has plenty of room!! I love this bag!!!
customer_reviews.author: Azjah Lynn Hinkley

customer_reviews.title: This bag looks good it holds a lot of yarn but the zippers ...
customer_reviews.text: This bag looks good it holds a lot of yarn but the zippers are real Slim Z they ripped and you can't fix them the zippers are very bad quality the bag itself over on with a nice-looking bag but the zipper breaks and comes off track very easily and now you can't use the bat I wouldn't suggest buying this bag I would look for something a little bit more sturdier
customer_reviews.author: Kisha mckiver

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: If you like being organized you should buy this tote bag, great storage space for your yarns etc....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfectly large capacity
customer_reviews.text: This bag is perfect. Carries all my accessories, tools, and yarn for multiple projects. I currently have two skeins of bernat blanket, and 8 skeins of red heart super saver. And there is plenty of room for all of my hooks, and small pieces as well.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle T

customer_reviews.title: Not quite what I expected :(
customer_reviews.text: This bag was a Christmas gift for our Daughter. The clear plastic parts (most of the bag), seem pretty cheaply made - thin but stiff, like it might tear easily with even casual use. Also irritating that the top does not open all of the way - will probably make it difficult to put projects inside the large compartment. Placement of yarn and other pockets seems very convenient. Time will tell if this bag will perform as advertised or not.
customer_reviews.author: Ise Loa

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I like having everything organized and together, but I do wish this was made with better quality materials. This only holds 5 small skeins, zippers for hooks & markers and a smallish project so not so good for larger projects.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Bag
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag for my grandmother, she loves to knit and takes her projects everywhere with her. She loves this bag! She can’t stop talking about it and showing it off. Its very roomy and can hold pretty big skeins of yarn!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a friend for Christmas who lives in another state, so I have not seen this in person yet, only through pictures. She was able to put 6 skeins with no problem in there for the blanket she is working on. She said for her it worked great and she really liked it. I like the concept of how it is made as well, which is why I purchased it for her. As far as durability, only time will tell, but I like the fact that it is not heavy/bulky to start with.
customer_reviews.author: HFN

customer_reviews.title: In my opinion, it’s adequate for storage & stationary home use; not sturdy enough for travel.
customer_reviews.text: Does the job of containing yarn, hooks, needles. However as I went to put my project away (using the attached shoulder strap) the plastic side pocket ripped along the seam above the zipper - on the day I received it.
customer_reviews.author: VintageCat

customer_reviews.title: Okish
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews and some people love it some people hate it but I gave it a try. The plastic is very easily ripped and the zippers broke the second time I used them. I replaced the zippers and it’s fine now. It doesn’t the job
customer_reviews.author: Christine crockett

customer_reviews.title: I love everything about it!
customer_reviews.text: Way larger than I expected. Love the additional storage space on the back side. Works perfectly and is light weight, easy to carry on shoulder. I love the easy see thru zipper space on top to hold all my needles. The two see thru side pockets are great for my notes and supplies, plus they have Velcro straps to help keep items in. The see thru zipper spaces that holds the yarn actually fits 2 per space, with two lead holes and Velcro per hole to secure your yarn. This makes it easy for me: to transport, to start a new project or pick up where I left off on my current project.Great value!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sheila

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again my sister bought one to.
customer_reviews.text: Love the bag stores all my yarn perfectly. And it great to keep your yarn separate when your knitting
customer_reviews.author: Debra havens

customer_reviews.title: Little Disappointed..
customer_reviews.text: This bag has a very strong plastic smell. I tried to put 1 Red Heart Supersaver skein in each clear area. Doesn't fit very well. I pulled the yarn through the little holes at the top of the bag. Yarn didn't want to come out. Maybe smaller skeins or balls will work better.
customer_reviews.author: jempurple

customer_reviews.title: ) The concept is very good. The product is poorly made
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited about receiving this purchase...until I opened it. One of the zippers is broken and a Velcro closure was only connected by two threads (They missed the end of the tab when trying to sew it into the seam.) The concept is very good. The product is poorly made. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with this bag.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect bag for my project. I ordered this after reading the other reviews and have decided I love this. I don't notice the heavy plastic smell that others said, and I stuffed my bag and the fabric hasn't torn. It can't be difficult to get two skeins in each section especially because I wind some of my own and the different shapes make it difficult. Overall though I'm very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Ellie Mae

customer_reviews.title: This would have been perfect for my projects if the zipper hadn't torn almost ...
customer_reviews.text: This would have been perfect for my projects if the zipper hadn't torn almost immediately the first time I tried to open it. Great for organizing and keeping yarn from tangling, but a bit disappointed with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa M.

customer_reviews.title: Just Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I like that I can grab it and go with everything I need. Plenty of storage space.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth C. Hardeman

customer_reviews.title: not durable
customer_reviews.text: I loved everything about this except after about a week one of the compartments for the yard tore.
customer_reviews.author: Candace Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: The idea of how this bag is supposed to work is great. However, my yarn does not easily come out of the grommet/ pouch easy at all until it’s about half used. I use Hobby Lobby brand I Love This Yarn for comparison. I’m also upset that my shoulder strap has already ripped for no more than I’ve used the bag to transport my projects . Will not order another one
customer_reviews.author: Amy Neal

customer_reviews.title: Decent bag but there is one issue
customer_reviews.text: The bag works and for the price it is quite nice. The only issue is the center divider is not attached to the bottom of the bag nor the top. So if you move it around there is a chance items will shine around and go under the cloth divider. My wife solved this by stitching hers in place with some liquid stitch and thread.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Its perfect
customer_reviews.text: I crocted...A LOT. I can fit up to 6 super large skeins in here or just a few (12) normal sized. Pockets are great for needles and safty eyes and any thing you may need to work away from home. It feels terribly cheep fresh out the packaging.. this bag has been with me for 2 yrs with no ripping and i have bought it for other people for gifts. Great find by my husband
customer_reviews.author: Sara Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Travel
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a gift my sister loves to travel with it holds all her knitting stuff
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: This didnt work for me. I guess it's fine if you are using a little ball of yarn. It didn't fit the Bernat Chenille large skein or the Caron One Pounder skeins well at all. The yarn would not glide out the hole.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of these bags that I was given for Christmas last year, I love them and they work very well. I take them with me often and they don't fall apart. Purchased one for my DIL this year and she loves it too
customer_reviews.author: Jean Mason

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, good design
customer_reviews.text: Great idea and design but poor quality. Flimsy and collapses on itself. Useable but would not recommend
customer_reviews.author: Tanya

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I was making a baby blanket for 3 different colors and this tote bag worked perfectly! I was able to carry my yarn, work in progress, needles & instructions all in one great portable tote! Would recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Well built and holds lots of yarn, protects and tools.
customer_reviews.text: I was amazed at the size and how much it could hold! It is well built. I plan to but another one for my daughter.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer thomas

customer_reviews.title: would order another in a heartbeat
customer_reviews.text: I love my bag. Perfect for carrying my crochet project (which is very large), yarn, and supplies. I did have an issue with the back zipper area coming apart but I contacted the company and within 2 days they had another shipped out to me. If I ever need a new one I will definitely order from this company and order this bag again. I just love it!
customer_reviews.author: brownie06921

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected from the picture.
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply made. The picture looks way better than the actual product. Mine arrived with the zipper messed up and a pocket already torn. It's too thin & flimsy for my taste. You might as well us a plastic grocery bag to tote your yarn. If it was of heavier material I would consider keeping it, but in my opinion it's a waste of money because it won't last a month. Unless you plan on barely using it.
customer_reviews.author: CyntChris

customer_reviews.title: It holds everything in especially a lot of yarn
customer_reviews.text: The bag is perfect especially if you tapestry crochet it keeps all of yours separated love the bag
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I may just have to buy another I love this one so much!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE it!!! Holds all my yarn for current project at once. Keeps yarn safe and clean. Lots of room, holds the JUMBO skeins of yarn. Pockets to keep tools and even pattern books as well as the granny squares I am making! Fairly sturdy too. The holes the yarn comes through are large and heavy and as long as I don't overload it I expect this to hold up and last!
customer_reviews.author: Deja

customer_reviews.title: Make a nice Gift
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves this tote and decided to buy an extra one, very handy and well made.
customer_reviews.author: BBGun

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I love my tote bag! I can take so much with me. Even several projects at a time. I work 10 hour shifts or more and I have everything o need to work on my crochet products
customer_reviews.author: Jessa

customer_reviews.title: Worth the12 dollars
customer_reviews.text: I really do like it. I wish they had one would hold balls of yarn. However, it works for my projects. It has 6 holes with metal grommets so you can pull your yarn thru. Also a thin pocket for your needles. Another pocket other things. Then a big pocket for other your project for travel. Like I said I only wish they would make one that holds 12 yarns. That why I gave it 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Gussy

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: This tote is wonderful. Lots of storage to put everything. I was kind of hesitate because of some of the reviews but I haven't had any issues at all. I also thought it would be cheap material because of the price and it's definitely not. I stuff this bag full and bring it to work every Monday and it's still holding up!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Fox

customer_reviews.title: great for a multiple color yarn project
customer_reviews.text: zippered pockets to keep yarn separate as well as a way to hold the ends. plenty of space to hold extra skeins,instruction,what ever is needed. I applaud the creator!
customer_reviews.author: Rebelgimp

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: I do plastic canvas and crochet this helps a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Cool
customer_reviews.text: This is wonderful at holding all my projects. It's a little large for traveling tho.
customer_reviews.author: Janiel

customer_reviews.title: Excelent!!
customer_reviews.text: Excelent!!!!!! It comes with more that I sow!!!!!!! As the ziper for needles and the side too! Plus half side is for storage yarn and other for dispenser!!!!! 👍🏻 Excelente!!!!! Viene con todo cómo compartimento con cierre para agujas y lateral!!!!! Igual a la q cuesta $35.00!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Betty

customer_reviews.title: Yarn tote
customer_reviews.text: The portion of the bag which is behind the section where the skeins of yarn go is difficult to access. It would be really great if it opened so you could easily place the item you are working on into that portion of the bag. The side pocket isn't large enough to place a standard size pattern magazine into and the top zippered section for accessories has the zipper on the diagonal so it is easy for some items to fall out.
customer_reviews.author: Georgette Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Best yarn tote bag ever designed!!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Its even better then I thought it would be. Wish I would have bought it a lot sooner. Its very durable, has a lot more little compartments then I realized and holds a lot of yarn. Keeps yarn from getting knotted up and saves time trying to remember which end of the skein you were working with. Great price as well, cant beat it!! Highly recommend this A+++++ product to all yarn enthusiasts.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa C

customer_reviews.title: it is pretty low quality material
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't purchase this again. Only because the divider between the storage and the spot where you can put the yarn and feed the yarn through does not connect on the bottom. So it slides underneath. Also, it is pretty low quality material. It is fine for packing up to take with. But you cannot put much yarn it for fear it will get tangled up.
customer_reviews.author: Romance Lover

customer_reviews.title: Broken zippers galore!
customer_reviews.text: The zipper to the main part of the bag broke within a week of using. Also, one of the zippers on the front broke shortly after that one. The quality of materials used to make this item are poor.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Helping hands
customer_reviews.text: I love the way that I can keep everything organize. It makes changing colors when I am working so much easier. i really love it.
customer_reviews.author: ericka ennis

customer_reviews.title: Great to make your knitting/crocheting projects portable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my sister and she loves it. She can put multiple yarns and projects in it and easily travel with it.
customer_reviews.author: dbsews

customer_reviews.title: ♥️
customer_reviews.text: Great size...fit a lot of yarn and lots of extra space. Love it
customer_reviews.author: CD Harden

customer_reviews.title: Not big enough for chubs, holes for yarn nice
customer_reviews.text: It is not big enough for the chubs, and when you put 2 scanes of yarn in, you can only see one of them. I do like the way the yarn comes out the hole and doesn't get lost or mixed up when you have to do the colors in order. It also has a place to put your work when it is small. There is a pocket for your needles and books, too.
customer_reviews.author: White Haired Lady

customer_reviews.title: Very handy
customer_reviews.text: This is a great way to keep yarn separate but handy!
customer_reviews.author: Julianne J Baker

customer_reviews.title: Easy To Use & Great For Organizing Yarn For Looming
customer_reviews.text: I like to loom knit and needed a better way to organize my yarn for my "active" projects. This was a great solution and I love it. I have used it for over 6 months and it is still working well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't Expect It to Last Long
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was looking for - large, enclosed pockets for my yarn with 6 holes to work yarn from. I really love the back storage for projects, too. A huge draw to this was the ability to keep my skeins encloses and cat hair-free! With that said, two of the zippers broke within the first WEEK. I was so disappointed! With two of the three yarn pockets out of commission, this bag is now pretty useless. I've tried fixing it, but the material is so cheap and the construction so shoddy, it's not worth it. Lesson learned - you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very roomy!!!
customer_reviews.text: This bag is perfect for storing yarn and related supplies such as books, needles/hooks, etc. It really holds a lot. I've loaded mine with all of the yarn and tools needed for my next project...a large afghan. I love the fact that I will be able to carry my project around and work from it (there are holes to feed the yarn through). And when not in use, this bag takes up minimal space. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Miller

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly convenient and great for organization
customer_reviews.text: This bag is the perfect grab and go project bag. I live on base 3-4 days a week. I am working on 3 crochet projects a blanket, a beanie, and a doll. This bag holds everything I need ( 7 skeins of yarn, polyfill, hooks, scissors, embroidery floss, buttons, fabric, etc). I can just throw the strap on my shoulder and go with everything I need.
customer_reviews.author: Elisabeth Ingraham

product_meta.title: Miles Kimball Knitting Tote Bag, 18 x 11 x 1 inches
product_meta.description: Knitting Tote Bag organizes your knitting so you can take it “to-go!” Our yarn tote bag features individual, see-through compartments that hold up to 6 skeins. Thread yarn through lid grommets to prevent tangling and fraying. Roomy pockets store needles, gauges, pattern books, eyeglasses and more. Carrying strap and zip closure. Clear plastic, reinforced with polyester. 12" high x 15" wide x 9 1/2" deep.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars1,848 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
